properties.name: James Allen's Girls'
properties.highlights: Founded 1741, part of Edward Alleyn foundation with Dulwich College. Outstanding results - 46% A* in 2024. Top girls school.

properties.name: Ibstock Place School
properties.highlights: Founded 1894 as Froebel Demonstration School. Co-ed in Roehampton. Progressive educational approach.

properties.name: Chelsea Independent College
properties.highlights: Day and boarding sixth form college in Chelsea. GCSE, A-Level and Foundation courses. Small class sizes.

properties.name: Thomas's Kensington
properties.highlights: Part of Thomas London Day Schools. Prep school in fashionable Kensington. Creative, nurturing ethos.

properties.name: Notting Hill & Ealing High
properties.highlights: Founded 1873. GDST school. Top 20 UK for both GCSE and A-Level - one of only 10 schools to achieve this.

properties.name: Latymer Upper School
properties.highlights: Founded 1624 by Edward Latymer. Leading co-ed day school in Hammersmith. Strong drama tradition with notable alumni.

properties.name: Kingston Grammar School
properties.highlights: Founded 1561 by royal charter. Co-ed since 1978. Record-breaking 2024 A-Level results.

properties.name: German School London
properties.highlights: Founded 1971 in Richmond. German curriculum plus IB. 800+ students. Abitur and IB Diploma.

properties.name: Collingham College
properties.highlights: Founded 1975 in Kensington. Celebrates 50 years in 2025. Tutorial college with small classes. Oxbridge preparation.

properties.name: Trinity School Croydon
properties.highlights: Founded 1596 by Archbishop Whitgift. Part of Whitgift Foundation. Boys school with strong sport and academics.

properties.name: Eltham College
properties.highlights: Founded 1842. Sunday Times London Independent School of Year 2024. Strong maths and science. Co-ed.

properties.name: Highgate School
properties.highlights: Founded 1565. Co-ed since 2004. Victorian Gothic architecture in leafy Highgate Village. Alumni include John Betjeman.

properties.name: The Cavendish School
properties.highlights: Girls prep school in Camden Town. Small classes, exceptional pastoral care. Ages 3-11.

properties.name: Harrow School
properties.highlights: Founded 1572. Winston Churchill, Lord Byron, Benedict Cumberbatch among alumni. Full boarding school with 800 boys.

properties.name: Portland Place School
properties.highlights: Founded 1996. NOTE: School closed summer 2024. Was known for music and small class sizes.

properties.name: David Game College
properties.highlights: Founded 1974 in City of London. Independent sixth form college. Intensive and standard A-Level programmes.

properties.name: Sussex House School
properties.highlights: Founded 1952. Boys prep in Chelsea. Beautiful Norman Shaw designed building at Cadogan Square.

properties.name: Mill Hill School
properties.highlights: Founded 1807. Beautiful 120-acre campus. Day and boarding. Good sport facilities including 9-hole golf course.

properties.name: City of London School
properties.highlights: Founded 1834 on Thames embankment. Notable alumni include H.H. Asquith (PM), Julian Barnes, Daniel Radcliffe.

properties.name: Bales College
properties.highlights: Founded 1966 in West London. Independent school and sixth form. Small group teaching ages 13-19.

properties.name: Bromley High School
properties.highlights: Founded 1883. GDST school. Outstanding reputation for academics, sport and music. Beautiful campus.

properties.name: Hampton School
properties.highlights: Founded 1556. Was a grammar school until 1975. Strong rowing tradition - major competitor at Henley. Stephen Fry attended.

properties.name: Cameron House School
properties.highlights: Small co-ed prep in Chelsea. Only 20 children per year. Nurturing family atmosphere.

properties.name: Fulham Prep School
properties.highlights: Founded 1996. Co-ed prep in Fulham. 3 campuses. 25 years of academic excellence. Part of Inspired Group.

properties.name: North Bridge House Senior
properties.highlights: Founded 1939. Co-ed across multiple North London campuses. Part of Cognita Group. Now linked with Alleyns.

properties.name: Emanuel School
properties.highlights: Founded 1594 in Wandsworth. Co-ed since 2012. Beautiful riverside campus. Top 50 independent school in UK.

properties.name: Eaton Square School
properties.highlights: Founded 1981 in Belgravia. Prep school for ages 2-11. Feeds to top London senior schools.

properties.name: International School of London
properties.highlights: Founded 1972. One of first IB Diploma schools in UK. Strong home language literacy programmes.

properties.name: ACS Cobham
properties.highlights: Founded 1967. 128-acre Surrey campus. Day and boarding. IB and AP curriculum. World-class facilities.

properties.name: St Helen's Northwood
properties.highlights: Founded 1899 in Northwood. One of UKs leading girls schools. 84% A*-A at A-Level. Strong sport.

properties.name: Haberdashers' Boys
properties.highlights: Founded 1690 by Haberdashers Company. Elstree campus shared with girls school. Strong sport and academics.

properties.name: University College School
properties.highlights: Founded 1830 in Hampstead. Liberal ethos, no CCF or chapel. Known for progressive values and strong academics.

properties.name: Croydon High School
properties.highlights: Founded 1874. GDST school in South London. 82% A*-B at A-Level 2024. Strong science and STEM.

properties.name: Surbiton High School
properties.highlights: Founded 1884. Part of United Church Schools Trust. 46% grade 9s at GCSE. Strong sport and music.

properties.name: Forest School
properties.highlights: Founded 1834 in Snaresbrook, East London. Large co-ed school. Beautiful Epping Forest location.

properties.name: MPW London
properties.highlights: Founded 1973. Tutorial-style teaching in small groups (under 10). GCSE and A-Level retakes specialist.

properties.name: Francis Holland Regent's Pk
properties.highlights: Founded 1878 by Canon Francis Holland. Church of England girls school near Regents Park. Warm, supportive ethos.

properties.name: Garden House School
properties.highlights: Founded 1950 in Chelsea. Educated offspring of diplomats and PMs including Churchill. Now co-ed prep.

properties.name: Channing School
properties.highlights: Founded 1885 in Highgate. Unique Unitarian foundation. Inclusive, supportive ethos with strong academics.

properties.name: Dulwich College
properties.highlights: Founded 1619 by actor Edward Alleyn. Alumni include P.G. Wodehouse, Raymond Chandler, Ernest Shackleton.

properties.name: ACS Egham
properties.highlights: Founded 1967. Part of ACS International Schools. Day and boarding. IB and AP curriculum.

properties.name: The Lyceum
properties.highlights: Founded 1997 in City of London. Co-ed prep 4-11. Creative, thematic teaching. Part of Dukes Education.

properties.name: Haberdashers' Girls
properties.highlights: Founded 1875 by Haberdashers Company. Shares 100-acre Elstree campus with boys school. Now offers co-ed sixth form.

properties.name: Wimbledon High School
properties.highlights: Founded 1880. GDST school. Exceptional 2024 results - 50% A* grades. Senior School of Year winner.

properties.name: Pembridge Hall
properties.highlights: Founded 1979 in Notting Hill. Girls prep 4-11. Part of Inspired Education Group. Feeds to top London senior schools.

properties.name: King's College School
properties.highlights: Founded 1829 by King George IV. Originally part of Kings College London. Beautiful Wimbledon campus.

properties.name: South Hampstead High
properties.highlights: Founded 1876. GDST school celebrating 150th anniversary. Strong academics in leafy Hampstead.

properties.name: St Paul's School
properties.highlights: Founded 1509 by John Colet. Ranked #1 UK school in 2025 (Sunday Times). First English school to teach Greek.

properties.name: Thomas's Battersea
properties.highlights: Founded 1971. Prince George and Princess Charlotte attended. Prep school feeding into top public schools.

properties.name: St James Senior Girls
properties.highlights: Founded 1975 in West Kensington. Unique philosophical approach with regular mindfulness. Transitioning to co-ed.

properties.name: Wetherby School
properties.highlights: Founded 1951. Boys prep in Notting Hill. Prince William and Harry attended. Feeds to Eton, Westminster, St Pauls.

properties.name: Putney High School
properties.highlights: Founded 1893. GDST school. Record-breaking 2024 A-Levels with best ever Oxbridge offers.

properties.name: Alleyn's School
properties.highlights: Founded 1619 by Edward Alleyn. Part of the Dulwich schools foundation with Dulwich College and JAGs. Co-ed since 1976.

properties.name: Dwight School London
properties.highlights: Full IB curriculum school. Ranked #1 for IB Diploma scores among all international schools in London. Top 100 IB globally.

properties.name: Colfe's School
properties.highlights: Founded 1652 in Lewisham. One of oldest schools in London. Co-ed. Strong sport including rowing.

properties.name: Glendower Prep
properties.highlights: Founded 1895 in South Kensington. Girls prep 4-11. Excellent 11+ results to top senior schools.

properties.name: Lycée Français Charles de Gaulle
properties.highlights: Founded 1915 in South Kensington. French curriculum. 3400+ students, 46 nationalities. Baccalauréat.

properties.name: Sydenham High School
properties.highlights: Founded 1887. GDST school in South East London. Best ever GCSE results 2025. Strong arts and music.

properties.name: Lady Eleanor Holles
properties.highlights: Founded 1711 in Cripplegate, moved to Hampton 1937. London Independent School of Year 2025. Known for music and sport.

properties.name: Bancroft's School
properties.highlights: Founded 1737 by Francis Bancroft. Woodford Green campus. Top 15 co-ed schools in UK. Strong music tradition.

properties.name: Hill House School
properties.highlights: Founded 1951 in Switzerland, moved to London. Prince Charles attended. Famous rust-coloured uniform. Swiss chalet trips.

properties.name: St Paul's Girls' School
properties.highlights: Founded 1904, sister school to St Pauls. Top UK girls school. Gustav Holst was Director of Music 1905-1934.

properties.name: The American School London
properties.highlights: Founded 1951 in St Johns Wood. American curriculum K-12. 50+ nationalities. Ivy League feeders.

properties.name: St Augustine's Priory
properties.highlights: Founded 1634. Catholic girls school in Ealing. 13-acre campus. Run by lay head since 1996 (originally by nuns).

properties.name: Godolphin & Latymer
properties.highlights: Hammersmith girls school. Offers both A-Level and IB. Kate Beckinsale, Davina McCall among alumni.

properties.name: Streatham & Clapham High
properties.highlights: Founded 1887. GDST school. ISI Excellent rating 2019. 100% A-Level pass rate.

properties.name: Queen's College London
properties.highlights: Founded 1848 on Harley Street. First institution to award academic qualifications to women in UK. Historic pioneer.

properties.name: Merchant Taylors' School
properties.highlights: Founded 1561 by Merchant Taylors Company. 285-acre Sandy Lodge campus. One of original nine Clarendon Schools.

properties.name: Northwood College
properties.highlights: Founded 1878. GDST school in Northwood. 100% top scores in Music, Further Maths, French.

properties.name: Harrodian School
properties.highlights: Founded 1993 on former Harrods Sports Club site in Barnes. Co-ed 4-18. Creative arts strength. Celebrity alumni.

properties.name: Ashbourne College
properties.highlights: Founded 1981 in Kensington. Sixth form college. GCSE and A-Level specialist. Small tutorial groups.

properties.name: Eaton House Schools
properties.highlights: Founded 1897. Group of single-sex prep schools in Belgravia. Ages 2-13. Part of Dukes Education.

properties.name: Eton College
properties.highlights: Founded 1440 by King Henry VI. 20 UK Prime Ministers including Boris Johnson, David Cameron. Most famous public school.

properties.name: Blackheath High School
properties.highlights: Founded 1880. GDST school. Best ever A*-B results 2025. Beautiful Blackheath location.

properties.name: L'Ecole des Petits
properties.highlights: Founded 1977 in Fulham. First French bilingual school recognised by AEFE in Britain. Ofsted Outstanding.

properties.name: Kensington Park School
properties.highlights: Formed 2020 from Chelsea Independent College merger. Day and boarding. Ages 11-18 in Bayswater and South Ken.

properties.name: The Hampshire School
properties.highlights: Founded 1944. Chelsea prep in former Chelsea Library (Grade II listed). Ages 3-13.

properties.name: Chelsea Academy
properties.highlights: Founded 2009. FREE state academy (Church of England). Co-ed secondary and sixth form in Chelsea.

properties.name: St Dunstan's College
properties.highlights: Founded 1888 in Catford. Co-ed. Record-breaking 2024 results. Strong drama and music.

properties.name: Whitgift School
properties.highlights: Founded 1596 by Archbishop John Whitgift. South Croydon. Strong sport especially rugby and cricket. Offers IB and A-Level.

properties.name: City of London School for Girls
properties.highlights: Founded 1894 in the Barbican. Ranked 2nd best independent school UK (Sunday Times 2018). Notable alumni include Dido.

properties.name: More House School
properties.highlights: Founded 1953 by Canonesses of St Augustine. Catholic girls school in Knightsbridge. Ages 9-18.

properties.name: Francis Holland Sloane Sq
properties.highlights: Founded 1881 by Canon Francis Holland. Church of England girls school near Sloane Square. Best ever A* results in 2024.

properties.name: DLD College London
properties.highlights: Central London sixth form college near Westminster. Day and boarding. A-Level, BTEC and IB. 98% pass rate.

properties.name: St James Senior Boys
properties.highlights: Founded 1975 in Ashford, Surrey. Unique philosophical approach. Transitioning to co-ed.

properties.name: Birkbeck School
properties.highlights: Historic school with educational heritage. Named after George Birkbeck, founder of mechanics institutes.

properties.name: Fairley House School
properties.highlights: Founded 1982 as UKs first dyslexia school. Specialist education for specific learning difficulties. GCSE programme.

properties.name: Westminster School
properties.highlights: Founded 1560 in Westminster Abbey precincts. 7 UK Prime Ministers, 3 Nobel laureates. Highest Oxbridge acceptance rate nationally.

properties.name: Knightsbridge School
properties.highlights: Founded 2006. Modern prep in Chelsea. Prepares for 8+ and 11+ entry to top schools.

properties.name: North London Collegiate
properties.highlights: Founded 1850 by Frances Mary Buss, pioneer of womens education. Consistently top 3 UK girls schools. Offers A-Level and IB.

properties.name: Southbank International
properties.highlights: First UK school to offer all 3 IB programmes. 70 nationalities. Average IB score 37.7 (world avg 29.8).

properties.name: Falkner House
properties.highlights: Founded 1954. Family-run girls prep in South Kensington. Now also has boys school on Penywern Road.

properties.name: ACS Hillingdon
properties.highlights: Founded 1967 near Heathrow. Part of ACS International Schools. Day school only. IB curriculum.

properties.name: Fine Arts College
properties.highlights: Founded 1978 in Hampstead. Only independent college in London specialising in arts and humanities. Award-winning.

properties.name: Kew House School
properties.highlights: Founded 2013. Part of Gardener Schools Group. Innovative co-ed senior school in West London.

properties.name: Lansdowne College
properties.highlights: Established sixth form college in Bayswater. GCSE and A-Level courses. NOTE: May have closed.
